title.narrative: Holstein Artificial Insemination Improves Income of Farmers Families in North Myzeqeja

description.narrative: This project will be implemented in four different villages in the northern part of Myzeqeja region of Albania (Kavaja area). The project goal is to increase the income of 1,240 farm families (Original and POG) by using artificial insemination (AI) to improve the quality of cow breeds in the project area. Knowledge, skills and agriculture inputs will also be improved. Technicians of four villages will receive 3,060 doses of high-quality Holstein breed semen. The semen will be used for the AI of local cows in 620 farm families. These families have approximately 1,100 cows. After successful pregnancy and calving periods, farmers will have better reproductive animal performance, quality offspring, and more productive cows in the future. As a result, farmers will increase their family income. The project will support the technicians with training in AI techniques, efficiency of reproduction performance, and the prevention and treatment of reproductive disorders. Farmers will be supported with training, technical assistance and agriculture inputs to support the rearing of good female calves for replacement. Each beneficiary family will pass on the value of the frozen semen while their cows are pregnant. In addition, they will pass on knowledge and skills to other beneficiary families. The project will also be supported by Bothar Ireland.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
